transcript.title: PM 116/1966 - DECENTRALISATION
transcript.content:
P. M. No. 116/ 1966

Commonwealth and State officials met in Canberra today toÂ discuss progress made in the work of a technical sub-committee of theÂ Commonwealth/& State Officials' Committee on Decentralisation.

The representatives of the States at the Conference were:
New South ' Wales
Victoria Queens land
South Australia
Western Australia
Tasmania -Mr. W A. Butterfield,
Director,
Department of Dacentralis ation and
Development
-Mr. J. Davies, Treasury.
-Mr. N. T. Howard,
Director, Division of State Development,
Premier's Department.
-Sir James Holt,
Co-ordinator -General of Public Works
E. J. Carey,
A ssistant Under -Treasurer,
Treasury Department.
-Mr. K. C. Belchamber,
Industries Promotions *, 1Search
Premier's Department
Mr. G. Cooper,
Director, Department of Industrial Development.
Mr. R. F. Boylen
Department of Industrial Development
Mr. J. E. Henshelwood,
Director, Industrial Development Branch,
Premier's and Chief Secretary's Department
The Commonwealth Departments participating were Treasury,
Trade and Industry, National Development, Labour and National Service,
Primary Industry and Prime Minister's Department.
Wlhile much useful work has been done to clarify many of the
important issues involved in a subject as complex as decentralisation, the
officials agreed that it would be necessary to collect and analyse further
information before conclusions of value could be reached. These steps are
now being taken.

CANBERRA, November, 1966
